cscie55.hw6

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie55.hw6.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents an ATM server for client requests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server(int port)
      Creates a new server given the port to listen to for client requests.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the server's connection.
      void listen()
      Listens to port for client connection requests and serves them.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method that instantiates the server and starts listening to requests from clients.
      boolean serveClient(java.net.Socket clientConnection)
      Serves the client by reading and executing its commands.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int port)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.io.IOException
        Creates a new server given the port to listen to for client requests.
        Parameters:
        port - Port number to listen to for client requests
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given port is not valid
        java.io.IOException - If server is unable to create a ServerSocket

    • Method Detail

      • listen

        public void listen()
        Listens to port for client connection requests and serves them.

      • serveClient

        public boolean serveClient(java.net.Socket clientConnection)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Serves the client by reading and executing its commands.
        Parameters:
        clientConnection - Socket connection to the client
        Returns:
        boolean Whether to close the connection with the client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If server was unable to get input stream from client

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the server's connection.

        Main method that instantiates the server and starts listening to requests from clients.
        Parameters:
        args - Array containing its port number on args[0]
